page.title: 15Pocket money in Stockwood.
page.content: We did a survey about the amounts of pocket money that children in our school were given. We found that the older the person the more money they got. Most of the younger infants have no pocket money at all. Most of the older infants had between Â£0.25p and Â£0.50p per week but average pocket money for the older children was between Â£0.75p and Â£1.00 per week. Only a few children had more than Â£1.00. When we asked what they spent their pocket money on most children said they saved it up. A few said they saved some but spent a little on sweets. Only one person said that they spent their money on magazines and one on fruit. Only two people said that they spent money on drinks. 18 children said that they spent all their money on sweets. 4 said they spent their money on comics.
